content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="N of t, equals, f of t, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than 6; N of t, equals, 25 t, plus 150, for 6 less than or equal to t, less than 8; N of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 200 plus 80, t, and denominator 2 plus, 0.05, t, end fraction, for t greater than or equal to 8."><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>25</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>150</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>200</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The number of fish in a pond at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> years is modeled by the function <math alttext="N"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a continuous function such that <math alttext="f of 0, equals 80"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, N of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Explain the meaning of <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, N of t"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="N of t, equals, f of t, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than 6; N of t, equals, 25 t, plus 150, for 6 less than or equal to t, less than 8; N of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 200 plus 80, t, and denominator 2 plus, 0.05, t, end fraction, for t greater than or equal to 8."><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>25</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>150</mn></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>200</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.05</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The number of fish in a pond at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> years is modeled by the function <math alttext="N"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined above, where <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a continuous function such that <math alttext="f of 0, equals 80"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, N of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Explain the meaning of <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, N of t"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(b) Is the function <math alttext="N"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> continuous at <math alttext="t equals 8 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(c) The function <math alttext="N"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous at <math alttext="t equals 6"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Is there a time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 6"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which <math alttext="N of t, equals 250 "><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Confirm whether hypotheses or conditions of a selected definition, theorem, or test have been satisfied.
